intro: Parosela lutea var. caudata, commonly known as the yellow parosela or the cat-tail parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture, while the flowers bloom in umbels, giving it a delicate, clustered appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
